intro: Polygonum olivieri, commonly known as the olive dock, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its distinct nodes and hollow stems. The plant features broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss. It produces small, greenish flowers arranged in dense clusters, typically blooming in late summer. Polygonum olivieri is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
